title: Bug 102436 - Date/time value not stored correctly in report design
description: An invalid date/time string (which does not conform to a universal format or the system default locale format) should have been rejected.
OB: When creating a new DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the report designer does not reject it.
EB: When creating a new DateTime type report parameter in BIRT report designer, if an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999', is entered in the 'default value' field, the report designer should reject it and display an error message.
SR:
1. Open the BIRT report designer.
2. Create a new report parameter of type 'DateTime'.
3. In the 'default value' field, enter an invalid date string, such as '55/66/9999'.
4. Save the report.
5. Verify that the report designer rejects the invalid date string and displays an error message.
